Posts.Content: Hi all,  I’ve been reading up - thanks for all the useful links, info, experiences and positive vibes etc.  I feel a bit of a fraud as I have the v low lv cancer - primary, breast conserving n I do not have to have chemo (ty Oncotype). However, although I’m v fortunate it’s still a tricky thing to cope with. After each apt I plan to return to work but then cry off -coz I’m crying.  I’m at the stage of awaiting the apt for the planning radiotherapy sessions and i’m also beginning to think about the pos/neg effects of tamoxifen. I’ve not quite got to grips with either.  Found this website today, after attending the 4 wk post-op follow-up group meeting at Mcmillian. Figured I’d give it a go and glad I attended. I’m finding the whole experience more upsetting than I would like and glad I’ve taken my original breast care nurse’s advice n not google but find McMillan or breatscare. I’ll continue to read up and be inspired by you all. Xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: P.s I have been working generally...but I mean after the apts. I get so upset even with overall good news. It’s a new job so don’t wanna mess it up etc etc
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢
